person.content:
Please identify the "Person" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Kinshasa opposes airdrops , apparently because the food could fall into the hands of the rebels and their local supporters .

Let's think step by step.

| Person |
| --- |
| rebels |
| their local supporters |

In this paragraph, the "Person" entities are "rebels" and "their local supporters." These entities are identified as people because they are involved in the conflict in Kinshasa and have a stake in the outcome of the airdrops. The word "rebels" refers to a group of people who are fighting against the government, and "local supporters" refers to people who are supporting the rebels in their community.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Person" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Person".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Person |
| --- |
| rebels |
| their local supporters |

In this paragraph, the "Person" entities are "rebels" and "their local supporters." The word "airdrops" is not a person, but rather a type of military or humanitarian operation. The phrase "their local supporters" implies that this is a group of people, so it is also a "Person" entity. The word "Kinshasa" is a location and not a person, so it is not included in the table.
